intro: Eupatorium areniscophilum, commonly known as sandplain eupatorium, is a flowering plant native to the coastal plain regions of the southeastern United States. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in dunes or open woodlands. The plant produces showy, pale blue to lavender flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. Its foliage is usually gray-green, and it has a spreading growth habit with hairy stems. Eupatorium areniscophilum is adapted to coastal environments and is often found in areas with high salinity and wind exposure.
